overview: From 2025-08-08 to 2025-08-09, elizaos/eliza had 8 new PRs (9 merged), 2 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topIssues.title: üêõ Build failure in @elizaos/core causing bun run clean to fail
topIssues.author: monilpat
topIssues.body:
## Description

The `bun run clean` command is failing due to TypeScript errors in `@elizaos/core` package during the DTS (type definition) build phase.

## Error Details

### Build Process
```
‚Ä¢ Running build in 17 packages
‚Ä¢ Remote caching disabled
@elizaos/config:build: cache miss
@elizaos/autodoc:build: cache miss
@elizaos/core:build: cache miss
```

### TypeScript Errors in @elizaos/core/src/utils.ts
1. Line 218: `error TS2345: Argument of type '`${string}-${string}-${string}-${string}-${string}`' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
2. Line 366: `error TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
3. Line 409: `error TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
4. Line 536: `error TS2345: Argument of type '{ numberOfChunks: number; averageChunkSize: number; }' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`

### Impact
- Blocks `bun run clean` command
- Prevents successful build of `@elizaos/core`
- Affects dependent packages in the monorepo

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run `bun run clean`
2. Observe build failure in `@elizaos/core`
3. Build fails with TypeScript errors during DTS generation

## Expected Behavior
- `bun run clean` should complete successfully
- `@elizaos/core` should build without TypeScript errors
- Type definitions should be generated correctly

## Suggested Fix

The errors suggest type mismatches in `utils.ts`. Need to:
1. Review type definitions in affected lines
2. Update type assertions or generic constraints
3. Ensure string template literal types are properly handled
4. Fix object type assignments

### Files to Update
- `packages/core/src/utils.ts`

## Priority
**HIGH** - This is blocking clean builds and potentially affecting development workflow.

topIssues.title: release workflow should not replace @elizaos packages with version number in monorep
topIssues.author: linear

topPRs.title: fix missing pino logger refactors
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
### Summary
- Convert logger calls across the repo to object-first structured logging to align with pino typings and fix TS/DTS errors.
- No functional behavior changes; improves type-safety and log structure.

### Why
- Recent stricter typings select the ‚Äúmessage-only‚Äù overload when a string is first, causing TS2345 when a second argument is passed.
- Pino‚Äôs canonical usage is `logger.<level>(obj, msg)` for structured data.

### What changed
- Repo-wide refactor: replace string-first + extra arg with object-first structured calls; avoid passing arrays/objects as the second arg.
- Updated event/provider logs to attach data via an object, not as additional args.

### Affected packages
- core: minimal/no change in this pass
- server: converted error/warn/info usages in `packages/server/src/index.ts`
- cli: multiple files under `packages/cli/src/**` (start/test/update/utils), including top-level `src/index.ts`
- plugin-bootstrap: actions/providers/services/evaluators and `src/index.ts`
- plugin-dummy-services: `src/tokenData/service.ts`
- plugin-starter: `src/plugin.ts` (action error and event param keys)
- plugin-quick-starter: `src/plugin.ts` (event message/world logs)
- project-starter:
  - `src/index.ts` (character name log)
  - `src/plugin.ts` (action error, events param keys)
  - tests under `src/__tests__/*.ts` updated to structured error logs
- project-tee-starter: `src/plugin.ts` (keypair/signature logs, TEE warnings, event message preview)

### Pattern (before ‚Üí after)
```ts
// Before (string-first + extra arg)
logger.error('Error in action:', error);
logger.debug('Message:', params.message);
logger.info('[EVENT]', previewText);

// After (object-first)
logger.error({ error }, 'Error in action:');
logger.debug({ message: params.message }, 'Message:');
logger.info({ preview: previewText }, '[EVENT]');
```

### Impact
- Fixes TS2345/‚Äúnever‚Äù overload errors during DTS builds (observed in plugin-starter, plugin-quick-starter, project-starter, project-tee-starter, etc.).
- Structured logs (JSON) with explicit keys; log parsing/search may improve. Some plain appended values move into fields (e.g., `message`, `world`, `signature`, `keys`, `error`).

### Testing
- Type-checks pass locally on edited files; DTS errors reported in build output addressed at call sites noted above.
- No runtime logic changed. Only log call signatures and shapes.

### Guidance for contributors
- Use object-first logging whenever attaching data:
  - Prefer: `logger.warn({ context }, 'message')`
  - Avoid: `logger.warn('message', context)` or passing arrays/objects as the second arg.
- For previews, attach as a named field: `{ preview: text.slice(0, 50) }`.

topPRs.title: feat: code formatting and linting improvements
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## üìù Description

This PR implements comprehensive code formatting and linting improvements across the entire ElizaOS codebase to enhance code quality, consistency, and maintainability.

## üîß Changes Made

### Code Formatting & Style
- Applied consistent code formatting across all packages
- Fixed indentation and spacing issues throughout the codebase
- Improved code readability with proper formatting standards
- Standardized import and export statements

### TypeScript Improvements
- **Fixed TypeScript any/never type violations** - replaced with specific, accurate types
- Enhanced type safety across the entire codebase
- Resolved TypeScript errors and warnings
- Improved type definitions in core packages

### Package & Documentation Updates
- Updated package.json files with consistent formatting
- Enhanced documentation formatting for better readability
- Fixed markdown formatting issues in README and docs files
- Applied consistent code style in test files

### Quality Improvements
- Fixed linting issues in test files and source code
- Enhanced error handling with proper types
- Improved code consistency across packages
- Better separation of concerns and code organization

## üß™ Testing

- All existing tests continue to pass
- Code compiles without TypeScript errors or warnings
- Linting rules are properly enforced
- No functional changes - purely formatting and type improvements

## üì¶ Affected Packages

-  - Type improvements and formatting
-  - Enhanced error handling and types
-  - Core type safety improvements
-  - Provider type enhancements
- All other packages - Consistent formatting and style

## ‚úÖ Quality Checklist

- [x] All TypeScript errors resolved
- [x] No any/never types used inappropriately
- [x] Consistent code formatting applied
- [x] All tests passing
- [x] Documentation updated where needed
- [x] No functional changes introduced

## üîó Related Issues

This addresses ongoing code quality and maintainability concerns across the ElizaOS codebase, following the established development principles of the project.

---

**Note**: This is a large formatting PR that touches many files but makes no functional changes. It focuses purely on improving code quality, type safety, and consistency.
